dependencies.description:
The NVIDIA HPC SDK is a comprehensive suite of compilers, libraries and
tools essential to maximizing developer productivity and the performance
and portability of HPC applications. The NVIDIA HPC SDK C, C++, and
Fortran compilers support GPU acceleration of HPC modeling and
simulation applications with standard C++ and Fortran, OpenACC
directives, and CUDA. GPU-accelerated math libraries maximize
performance on common HPC algorithms, and optimized communications
libraries enable standards-based multi-GPU and scalable systems
programming. Performance profiling and debugging tools simplify porting
and optimization of HPC applications.
dependencies.name: c

dependencies.description:
The NVIDIA HPC SDK is a comprehensive suite of compilers, libraries and
tools essential to maximizing developer productivity and the performance
and portability of HPC applications. The NVIDIA HPC SDK C, C++, and
Fortran compilers support GPU acceleration of HPC modeling and
simulation applications with standard C++ and Fortran, OpenACC
directives, and CUDA. GPU-accelerated math libraries maximize
performance on common HPC algorithms, and optimized communications
libraries enable standards-based multi-GPU and scalable systems
programming. Performance profiling and debugging tools simplify porting
and optimization of HPC applications.
dependencies.name: cxx

dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependencies.description: A Spack managed Python virtual environment
dependencies.name: python-venv

dependencies.description:
Widely used C++ template library for task parallelism. Intel Threading
Building Blocks (Intel TBB) lets you easily write parallel C++ programs
that take full advantage of multicore performance, that are portable and
composable, and that have future-proof scalability.
dependencies.name: tbb

dependent_to.description:
A generalist algorithm for cell and nucleus segmentation that can be
optimized for your own data
dependent_to.name: cellpose

dependent_to.description: Highly Efficient FFT for Exascale
dependent_to.name: heffte

dependent_to.description: OCTA is an integrated simulation system for soft materials.
dependent_to.name: octa

dependent_to.description:
Anvi’o is a comprehensive platform that brings together many aspects of
today’s cutting-edge computational strategies of data-enabled
microbiology, including genomics, metagenomics, metatranscriptomics,
pangenomics, metapangenomics, phylogenomics, and microbial population
genetics in an integrated and easy-to-use fashion through extensive
interactive visualization capabilities.
dependent_to.name: py-anvio

dependent_to.description:
Autoregressive Conditional Heteroskedasticity (ARCH) and other tools for
financial econometrics, written in Python (with Cython and/or Numba used
to improve performance)
dependent_to.name: py-arch

dependent_to.description:
Built based on the Apache Arrow columnar memory format, cuDF is a GPU
DataFrame library for loading, joining, aggregating, filtering, and
otherwise manipulating data.
dependent_to.name: py-cudf

dependent_to.description:
cuML is a suite of libraries that implement machine learning algorithms
and mathematical primitives functions that share compatible APIs with
other RAPIDS projects.
dependent_to.name: py-cuml

dependent_to.description: Scalable Machine Learning with Dask.
dependent_to.name: py-dask-ml

dependent_to.description:
Datashader is a data rasterization pipeline for automating the process
of creating meaningful representations of large amounts of data
dependent_to.name: py-datashader

dependent_to.description:
A scalable software framework for reinforcement learning environments
and agents/policies used for the Design and Control applications
dependent_to.name: py-exarl

dependent_to.description: Fractional Ridge Regression.
dependent_to.name: py-fracridge

dependent_to.description: A toolbox for accurate single-trial estimates in fMRI time-series data.
dependent_to.name: py-glmsingle

dependent_to.description:
inStrain is python program for analysis of co-occurring genome
populations from metagenomes that allows highly accurate genome
comparisons, analysis of coverage, microdiversity, and linkage, and
sensitive SNP detection with gene localization and synonymous non-
synonymous identification.
dependent_to.name: py-instrain

dependent_to.description:
An interactive toolkit for assembly and analysis of restriction-site
associated genomic data sets (e.g., RAD, ddRAD, GBS) for population
genetic and phylogenetic studies.
dependent_to.name: py-ipyrad

dependent_to.description: A python package for music and audio analysis.
dependent_to.name: py-librosa

dependent_to.description: Work with Loom files for single-cell RNA-seq data.
dependent_to.name: py-loompy

dependent_to.description: MNE python project for MEG and EEG data analysis.
dependent_to.name: py-mne

dependent_to.description:
NetKet is an open-source project, delivering cutting-edge methods for
the study of many-body quantum systems with artificial neural networks
and machine learning techniques.
dependent_to.name: py-netket

dependent_to.description: Reusable tools for working with next-generation sequencing (NGS) data.
dependent_to.name: py-ngs-tools

dependent_to.description: Use numba-compiled kernels from within Jax
dependent_to.name: py-numba4jax

dependent_to.description:
This package creates a quaternion type in python, and further enables
numpy to create and manipulate arrays of quaternions. The usual
algebraic operations (addition and multiplication) are available, along
with numerous properties like norm and various types of distance
measures between two quaternions. There are also additional functions
like "squad" and "slerp" interpolation, and conversions to and from
axis-angle, matrix, and Euler-angle representations of rotations. The
core of the code is written in C for speed.
dependent_to.name: py-numpy-quaternion

dependent_to.description: Python visualization tools for openPMD files
dependent_to.name: py-openpmd-viewer

dependent_to.description:
pandas is a fast, powerful, flexible and easy to use open source data
analysis and manipulation tool, built on top of the Python programming
language.
dependent_to.name: py-pandas

dependent_to.description:
Many useful operators, however, do not lend themselves to an explicit
matrix representation when used to solve large-scale problems. PyLops
operators, on the other hand, still represent a matrix and can be
treated in a similar way, but do not rely on the explicit creation of a
dense (or sparse) matrix itself. Conversely, the forward and adjoint
operators are represented by small pieces of codes that mimic the effect
of the matrix on a vector or another matrix.
dependent_to.name: py-pylops

dependent_to.description:
PyNNDescent is a Python nearest neighbor descent for approximate nearest
neighbors.
dependent_to.name: py-pynndescent

dependent_to.description:
pyts is a Python package for time series classification. It aims to make
time series classification easily accessible by providing preprocessing
and utility tools, and implementations of state-of-the-art algorithms.
Most of these algorithms transform time series, thus pyts provides
several tools to perform these transformations.
dependent_to.name: py-pyts

dependent_to.description: Interpret numpy arrays as quaternionic arrays with numba acceleration
dependent_to.name: py-quaternionic

dependent_to.description: Efficient sample rate conversion in python
dependent_to.name: py-resampy

dependent_to.description:
RMM: RAPIDS Memory Manager. Achieving optimal performance in GPU-centric
workflows frequently requires customizing how host and device memory are
allocated.
dependent_to.name: py-rmm

dependent_to.description:
Scanpy is a scalable toolkit for analyzing single-cell gene expression
data built jointly with anndata.
dependent_to.name: py-scanpy

dependent_to.description:
SHAP (SHapley Additive exPlanations): a unified approach to explain the
output of any machine learning model.
dependent_to.name: py-shap

dependent_to.description: This library provides multi-dimensional sparse arrays.
dependent_to.name: py-sparse

dependent_to.description: Pandas extension arrays for spatial/geometric operations.
dependent_to.name: py-spatialpandas

dependent_to.description:
Evaluate and transform D matrices, 3-j symbols, and (scalar or spin-

dependent_to.name: py-strawberryfields

dependent_to.description:

Gaussian boson sampling.
dependent_to.name: py-thewalrus

dependent_to.description:
UCSF pyem is a collection of Python modules and command-line utilities

dependent_to.name: py-ucsf-pyem

dependent_to.description:
Uniform Manifold Approximation and Projection (UMAP) is a dimension
reduction technique that can be used for visualisation similarly to

dependent_to.name: py-umap-learn

dependent_to.description:

dependent_to.description:
Python library to read and process pulsar data in several different
formats
dependent_to.name: py-your
